message.body: immunological trials. Good stuff. Note the big paragraph about allogeneic, which is really immunological in the best sense. http://www.cancerresearch.org/cancer-immunotherapy/impacting-all-cancers/multiple-myeloma
subject: list of criteria for trials
subject: Emerg numbers, readable? Flip in there now, thanks!
shit. No bright side to put on it, definitely a stressor on you, sorry. You know I'm so grateful, and she is too, no matter how she pushes your buttons. I will try to call her today.
I think it would feel nice to know almost all stones have been turned. Maybe I can get him to go home and exhaustively go through the government list of all trials in US.
Re: Sloan Kettering trials SEE CAPS BELOW
Allogeneic link Yup. Got to blend that into the Becker dialogue. And on flow chart. Answer to previous email: agreed on intro from themmrf.org <http://themmrf.org/> to Richardson.
subject: Re: Questions ahead of our appointment on Jan 6 8:40am
See my Titles of my evernote notes below, that tells how I use evernote.
subject: another apollo 13 kind of thought Since these decisions are literally life and death stakes, this is truly an adrenalin sport, the biggest one I'll ever play.

subject: FW: Questions ahead of our appointment on Jan 6 8:40am. NOT GOOD NEWS Well, she got it, and shit, she'd wanna go with the transplant in a week or at least the eariest I imagined-- on cyc 4. And the VERY POOR PROGNOSIS stings really badly. FUCK, SHIT.
Full paper on why 14,16 not bad prognosis: http://www.bloodjournal.org/content/bloodjournal/117/6/2009.full.pdf?sso-checked=true

subject: Studio on tail end? Julie points out that the Studio is equivalent and maybe better than the hotel for the long recovery phase, because she can cook good meals and bring them down to me...I can isolate from the noise and kids there and virus-y hotel cleaners etc. It's actually true and is a lot less lonely.
subject RE: Great job by Bob and me today
Important from notes of last Becker visit: she recommended TWO xplants in a row. Protocol 2070.

FW: Becker cyto report line The only line that wasn't on the VM FISH report was this: CYTOGENETICS/FLUORESCENCE IN-SITY HYBRIDIZATION (FISH): Per report, cytogenetics performed on the concurrent specimen at Diagnostic Cytogenetics Incorporated, Seattle, WA (N14-1537) showed abnormal karyotype: ISCN: 45,X,-Y[3]/85,X,i(X)(q10),-Y,-Y,+1,del(1)(p13)x2,-2,-4,-13,-13,-14,+15,-16,-16,-20,+mar1483-86,idem,+8[cp3]/46,XY[22].

She represents your inner very competent self, required for this emergency.

subj Re: FW: Quick follow ups Dr Becker Hi again Mr. Richmond-I should also let you know that after the first 80-90 days after allo transplant, that I am taking care of many patients who have had allogeneic transplants in my own practice, so I am well aware of the side effects. Also, I was co-first author on this attached study of post allo transplant maintenance in myeloma.

I am buffer-full after reading Becker's pdf and trying to figure out how it relates to Meilcarek's study. ... Now I'm seesawing back to auto + allo. Fun! (NOT).

subj RE: Great scientific amercian article on virus therapy Whoops, spoke too soon! There's this one: https://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT00450814?term=oncolytic+virus&rank=41 We did know about this measles thing at Mayo…and themmrf.org <http://themmrf.org/> put it down, but is it truly a dead issue? Would like to know for sure.

subj timing for the various tasks to the autologous transplant... Sunny, I have some logistical and timing questions so I can decide when to back my bags and stay at the marriott nearby during my transplant processes.

Did GREAT meditation this morning starting at 4am. Really got into a great zone. Breathing went to almost zero. Felt very relaxing and good. Once there, I visualized as specifically as I could good results for some of the things coming up, per Dr G.

subj Becker 1/28/15 My notes. Bottom line: gotta do both xplants, and they both SUCK big time and that's why I'm not sleeping tonight AT ALL. Sorry, venting.
Chatta communicated with Becker...here's his message to me (more from me afterwards):
So, Wendy, the below proposed email to Becker informs the Marriott dates.
My apology for the email Julie forwarded to you
If both on one side of the family, it will only affect one allele on each gene. The other side of that gene will still be random and different.

Becker promised to set me up with him, but fortunately I found an old email from Mike Halperin saying he'd set me up if there was any delay. Mielcarek will help with understanding the gvhd side of this.

subj RE: Should I get the pneumonia 23 and measles vaccines?

a fundamental problem in our research together: I'm the only one talking to docs. Even if I go to appointments with someone, the time for asking questions is still just my appointment time, and it's super limited. All these questions keep piling up, and I'm the bottleneck, and you guys can't help me get more answers (except via google, which sucks)! How do we fix this?
subj Apologies for being pushy; Chatta notes today

I've stupidly neglected to ask Mike Halperin to help me. He's the way into Berenson, for sure. Great recommendation of Applebaum. At lunch I'll ask him to set me up with Berenson. Then i think I'll have done a good job getting opinions from people biased on each side of the allo....

FW: CAR T cell already being done for MM!! WOW! I'm hoping to get onto pubmed (you have to be invited) to see where this is being done. But I bet Riddell could do it at Hutch too. I love how they want to study it in conjunction with autologous! Need to understand that a lot better…how the heck do they find the antigens if they've been reduced to zero in preparation? Maybe they're always expressed in all patient.
